channel.title: 2014 on Juan TORRES MUNGUÍA, PhD
channel.description: Recent content in 2014 on Juan TORRES MUNGUÍA, PhD

item.title: Comparison of Imputation Methods for Handling Missing Categorical Data with Univariate Pattern
item.description: Abstract This paper examines the sample proportions estimates in the presence of univariate missing categorical data. A database about smoking habits (2011 National Addiction Survey of Mexico) was used to create simulated yet realistic datasets at rates 5% and 15% of missingness, each for MCAR, MAR and MNAR mechanisms. Then the performance of six methods for addressing missingness is evaluated: listwise, mode imputation, random imputation, hot-deck, imputation by polytomous regression and random forests.
